Description: Fragment of tablet carved from limestone with Greek inscription.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Noted by Petrie in his Journal 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47) p.107 as having been found beside the 'altar mound (= the casemate building in the Great Temenos). Name, Ischyrion.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (no. 35)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (BA.30)
